H0.text: when was the problem of cfc 's discovered. 1957

H1.text: when was the problem of cfc 's discovered. 1969

H2.text: when was the problem of cfc 's discovered. 1970

H3.text: when was the problem of cfc 's discovered. 1974

A4.text: In 1974, it was first discovered by two University of California chemists, Professor F. Sherwood Rowland and Dr. Mario Molina, that the use of chlorofluorocarbons were causing a significant depletion in atmospheric ozone concentrations.

A5.text: Rowland's research, first published in Nature magazine in 1974, initiated a scientific investigation of the problem.
